body:
If the `find_by` method also should use duped attributes, you should use `temp_attrs` in both places:

```ruby
  temp_attrs = attributes.dup
  find_by(temp_attrs) || create(temp_attrs , &block)
```

Alternatively, if `find_by` doesn't need duped attrs, you should only dupe them for the `create` method so you don't spend cycles duping where its not needed:

```ruby
  find_by(attributes) || create(attributes.dup , &block)
```

Also, it would be great to have a test for this that ensures original attributes are no longer mutated.

Finally, why is duping an issue in find_or_create type methods but not in the underlying create/new methods? Should you instead modify the new/create methods to dupe?
